member.name: F:ResoniteModLoader.AssemblyHider.knownDotNetCompanies
member.summary: Companies that indicate an assembly is part of .NET This list was found by debug logging the AssemblyCompany for all loaded assemblies.

member.name: F:ResoniteModLoader.AssemblyHider.knownDotNetProducts
member.summary: Products that indicate an assembly is part of .NET. This list was found by debug logging the AssemblyProductAttribute for all loaded assemblies.

member.name: F:ResoniteModLoader.AssemblyHider.resoniteAssemblies
member.summary: Assemblies that were already loaded when RML started up, minus a couple known non-assemblies.

member.name: F:ResoniteModLoader.AssemblyHider.modAssemblies
member.summary: Assemblies that 100% exist due to a mod

member.name: F:ResoniteModLoader.AssemblyHider.dotNetAssemblies
member.summary: .NET assembiles we want to ignore in some cases, like the callee check for the AppDomain.GetAssemblies() patch

member.name: M:ResoniteModLoader.AssemblyHider.PatchResonite(HarmonyLib.Harmony,System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.Reflection.Assembly})
member.summary: Patch Resonite's type lookup code to not see mod-related types. This is needed, because users can pass arbitrary strings to TypeHelper.FindType(), which can be used to detect if someone is running mods.
member.param: Our RML harmony instance
Assemblies that were loaded when RML first started

member.name: M:ResoniteModLoader.AssemblyHider.IsModAssembly(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if an belongs to a mod or not.
member.param: The to check.
Type of root check being performed. Should be "type" or "assembly". Used in logging.
Name of the root check being performed. Used in logging.
If `true`, this will emit logs. If `false`, this function will not log.
If `true`, then this function will always return `false` for late-loaded types
member.returns: `true` if this assembly belongs to a mod.

member.name: M:ResoniteModLoader.AssemblyHider.IsModAssembly(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if an belongs to a mod or not.
member.param: The to check
If true, then this function will always return false for late-loaded types.
member.returns: true if this belongs to a mod.

member.summary: Checks if a belongs to a mod or not.

member.returns: true if this belongs to a mod.

member.name: M:ResoniteModLoader.AssemblyHider.GetCallingAssembly(System.Diagnostics.StackTrace)
member.summary: Get the calling using stack trace analysis, ignoring .NET assemblies. This implementation is SPECIFICALLY for the patch and may not be valid for other use-cases.

member.returns: The calling , or null if none was found.

member.name: M:ResoniteModLoader.ModConfiguration.Save(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Persist this configuration to disk.
This method is not called automatically.
member.param: If true, default values will also be persisted.
member.remarks: Saving too often may result in save calls being debounced, with only the latest save call being used after a delay.

member.name: M:ResoniteModLoader.ModConfiguration.SaveQueue(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Asynchronously persists this configuration to disk.
member.param: If true, default values will also be persisted.
If true, skip the debouncing and save immediately.
member.remarks: immediate isn't used anywhere nor exposed outside of internal, mods shouldn't be bypassing debounce.

member.name: M:ResoniteModLoader.ModConfiguration.SaveInternal(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs the actual, synchronous save
member.param: If true, default values will also be persisted

member.name: T:ResoniteModLoader.ModConfigurationException
member.summary: Represents an encountered while loading a mod's configuration file.

member.name: T:ResoniteModLoader.IncompatibleConfigurationHandlingOption
member.summary: Defines options for the handling of incompatible configuration versions.

member.name: F:ResoniteModLoader.IncompatibleConfigurationHandlingOption.ERROR
member.summary: Fail to read the config, and block saving over the config on disk.

member.name: F:ResoniteModLoader.IncompatibleConfigurationHandlingOption.CLOBBER
member.summary: Destroy the saved config and start over from scratch.

member.name: F:ResoniteModLoader.IncompatibleConfigurationHandlingOption.FORCELOAD
member.summary: Ignore the version number and attempt to load the config from disk.

member.summary: Called if this changed.

member.name: M:ResoniteModLoader.ModConfigurationKey.ValueType
member.summary: Get the of this key's value.

member.summary: Checks if a value is valid for this configuration item.

member.returns: true if the value is valid.

member.name: M:ResoniteModLoader.ModConfigurationKey.TryComputeDefault(System.Object@)
member.summary: Tries to compute the default value for this key, if a default provider was set.

member.returns: true if the default value was successfully computed.

member.name: M:ResoniteModLoader.ModConfigurationKey.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary:
We only care about key name for non-defining keys.
For defining keys all of the other properties (default, validator, etc.) also matter.
member.param: The other object to compare against.
member.returns: true if the other object is equal to this.

member.name: F:ResoniteModLoader.ModConfigurationKey.HasValue
member.summary: Set if this key has had a value assigned.

member.name: F:ResoniteModLoader.ModConfigurationKey.DefiningKey
member.summary:
Each configuration item has exactly ONE defining key, and that is the key defined by the mod. Duplicate keys can be created (they only need to share the same Name) and they'll still work for reading configs.
This is a non-null self-reference for the defining key itself as soon as the definition is done initializing.

member.name: T:ResoniteModLoader.ModConfigurationKey`1
member.summary: Represents a typed mod configuration key.
member.typeparam: The type of this key's value.

member.name: M:ResoniteModLoader.ModConfigurationKey`1.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Func{`0},System.Boolean,System.Predicate{`0})
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with the given parameters.
member.param: The mod-unique name of this config item.
The human-readable description of this config item.
The function that computes a default value for this key. Otherwise default() will be used.
If true, only the owning mod should have access to this config item.
The function that checks if the given value is valid for this configuration item. Otherwise everything will be accepted.

member.name: P:ResoniteModLoader.ModConfigurationKey`1.Value
member.summary:
Gets or sets the value of this configuration key.
When getting, attempts to retrieve the current value assigned to this key, or default(T) if none is set. When setting, assigns the provided value to this key and notifies any subscribers.

member.name: M:ResoniteModLoader.ModConfigurationKey`1.ValidateTyped(`0)
member.summary: Checks if a value is valid for this configuration item.
member.param: The value to check.
member.returns: true if the value is valid.

member.name: M:ResoniteModLoader.ModConfigurationKey`1.TryComputeDefaultTyped(`0@)
member.summary: Tries to compute the default value for this key, if a default provider was set.
member.param: The computed default value if the return value is true. Otherwise default(T).
member.returns: true if the default value was successfully computed.

member.returns: true if debug logging is enabled.

member.name: M:ResoniteModLoader.ResoniteMod.DebugFunc(System.Func{System.Object})
member.summary:
Logs an object as a line in the log based on the value produced by the given function if debug logging is enabled..
This is more efficient than passing an or a directly, as it won't be generated if debug logging is disabled.
member.param: The function generating the object to log.

member.name: M:ResoniteModLoader.Util.ExecutingMod(System.Diagnostics.StackTrace)
member.summary: Get the executing mod by stack trace analysis. You may skip extra frames if you know your callers are guaranteed to be RML code.

member.name: M:ResoniteModLoader.Util.Debounce``1(System.Action{``0},System.Int32)
member.summary:
Used to debounce calls to a given method. The given method will be called after there have been no additional calls for the given number of milliseconds.
The returned by this method has internal state used for debouncing, so you will need to store and reuse the Action for each call.
member.typeparam: The type of the debounced method's input.
member.param: The method to be debounced.
How long to wait before a call to the debounced method gets passed through.
member.returns: A debouncing wrapper for the given method.
